text: Boiry-Sainte-Rictrude is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Hauts-de-France region in northern France. ==Geography== A farming village located 7 miles (11 km) south of Arras on the D919 road. ==Population== ==Sights== * The church of St. Rictrude, rebuilt after the destruction of the village during World War I. * The sugar beet factory, one of the largest in France. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department ==References== * INSEE commune file Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais
title: Boiry-Sainte-Rictrude
